titleproper.value:
Guide to the C. B. Nichols Scrapbooks
                    <num>1974.134</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Larry Weimer (2011); Updated by John Zarrillo (2014)

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2014-09-30T14:56-0400</date>

extent.value: in two flat boxes and one manuscript box

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The collection includes five scrapbooks of Civil War era artifacts. Two scrapbooks hold envelopes with Union-themed images. One scrapbook includes Confederacy and Confederate state artifacts, especially currency and securities. Another scrapbook holds examples of various forms of scrip, not necessarily War-related, from several states. The final scrapbook holds a variety of documents on Union-related themes, including various Sanitary Commission fairs and other relief efforts, Colonel Elmer E. Ellsworth of the 11th New York Volunteer Infantry Regiment, and the Lincoln assassination.

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); C. B. Nichols scrapbooks, 1974.134, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
The scrapbooks were donated to the Long Island Historical Society (now Brooklyn Historical Society) by Percival Nichols of Bridgeton, Connecticut.
In addition to the scrapbooks, the collection contains one copy print of a 19th century photograph of a group of women holding an American flag (or quilt) in a gallery.

subject.value: Paper money |z Confederate States of America

corpname.value: Brooklyn and Long Island Fair in Aid of the United States Sanitary Commission. (1864).
